text:
So... weird and probably stupid question... Is there anyway to persist terminal commands like...
```run(`do thing like log into something`)
run(`do other thing that depends on the first thing`)```

text: I think that depends on what you mean by "persist"

text: So I've run into a weird situation where some powershell command runs an application and then it has some form of state, so you run some initialization program, then the following commands run off of that ones state? I actually don't understand how it works, if I close powershell it has no idea the initialization happened, ie loses state, and I can't run the other cmd's

text: it caches a bunch of files to disk, but I have no idea how it could hook into a shell instance and know if it had been closed...

text: ah apparently powershell supports global var's...

text:
I think you'd probably have to do the powershell equivalent of:
```run(`bash -c "first_command; second_command"`)```
